title.narrative: Strengthening and scaling-up CHAD's Child Protection Programming for Children, Adolescents and caregivers Affected by the crisis in northeast Nigeria

description.narrative:
- This is a case management, psycho social (PSS), foster care and community based child protection response program planned to be implemented in severely deprived regions of Pulka, Banki, Rann in Borno State. This project will focus on improving on the quality of child protection programming for unaccompanied and separated children and adolescent affected by the conflict in Borno State via a strong capacity building initiative designed to ensure proper supervision of case workers and reduction of caseloads per case worker. Intensive training sessions for case workers on quality case management procedures for CHAD case workers and other child protection actors in Borno State will be organized. 60 Community based Teachers from 3 LGAs in Borno State will also be trained on child protection in emergencies to enable them acquire the necessary skills to be able to participate in child protection activities especially in timely identification and referral of vulnerable and at-risk-children in their schools to CFS activities and peer to peer education program..
- 150 vulnerable alternative caregivers from 3 locations Pulka, Rann and Banki will be supported economically (cash) to support the care of UASC placed under their care and ensure they are being empowered to a certain degree to decide how best to meet their immediate needs by setting up of a small scale business of their choice. - An additional 600 caregivers will be trained on positive parenting to strengthen child protection efforts in these communities while 60 out of this 600 will be engaged to establish a Caregivers Child Protection Association (CCPA) As part of our strategy to strengthen community protection mechanisms in Pulka, Rann and Banki. the newly established CCPA will be supported monthly to carryout awareness and sensitization on Child protection to members of their communities.
- 3 adolescent centers will be established in 3 locations Pulka, Rann and Banki where a total of 3000 adolescents will be targeted for a peer-to-peer life skill education program. 1000 adolescent girls and boys per location will be reached with life skill education through their fellow adolescents. In this regard 120 adolescents aged 15-17 (40 per location) will be trained on A. Life skill education B. how to develop messages for awareness initiatives and C. how to manage group discussions with their peers around essential life skill development in their communities.
They will be trained on the use of simple reporting tools to capture data on the number on sessions held with peers, number of information education communication messages (IEC) in handbill and pamphlets distributed. Using key indicators they also will report on qualitative data around key achievements.
